column10: Sit on the cable machine with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
column11: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip
column12: slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column13: Lean back slightly and pull the handles towards your chest
column14: squeezing your shoulder blades together.
column15: Pause for a moment at the peak of the movement
column16: then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
column17: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip
column11: slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Engage your core and pull your shoulder blades down and back.
column13: As you pull yourself up
column14: bend one arm and bring your elbow towards your side
column15: while keeping the other arm straight.
column16: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar and your bent arm is fully flexed.
column17: Lower yourself back down with control
column18: straightening the bent arm and repeating the movement on the other side.
column19: Alternate sides with each repetition.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height.
column11: Place your hands on the parallel bars with a close grip
column12: palms facing each other.
column13: Hang from the bars with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
column14: Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bars
column15: keeping your elbows close to your body.
column16: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bars.
column17: Pause for a moment at the top
column18: then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
column19: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height settings.
column11: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip
column12: slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column13: Hang with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
column14: Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the handles
column15: keeping your elbows close to your body.
column16: Continue pulling until your chin is above the handles.
column17: Pause for a moment at the top
column18: then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
column19: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired assistance level.
column11: Stand on the foot platform and grip the handles with an overhand grip
column12: slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column13: Keep your chest up and shoulders back
column14: engage your core
column15: and slightly bend your knees.
column16: Pull your body up by flexing your elbows and driving your elbows down towards your sides.
column17: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
column18: Pause for a moment at the top
column19: then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
column20: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height settings.
column11: Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column12: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip
column13: slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column14: Engage your lats and biceps
column15: and pull yourself up towards the handles.

column18: Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
column19: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Place the stability ball on the ground and lie face down on top of it
column11: with your hips resting on the ball and your feet against a wall or other stable surface.
column12: Position your hands behind your head or crossed over your chest.
column13: Engage your core and slowly lift your upper body off the ball
column14: extending your back until your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels.
column15: Pause for a moment at the top
column16: then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
column17: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: core

column11: hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

column18: then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.

column10: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.

column16: Slowly raise your arms up and away from your body

column10: Attach the band to a pull-up bar or sturdy anchor point.

column18: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: core

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired height and secure your knees on the pad.

column5: assisted seated pectoralis major stretch with stability ball

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired height and secure your knees on the pad.

column10: Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
column11: Grasp the band handles with an overhand grip
column12: slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column13: Extend your arms fully
column14: pushing the bands away from your chest.
column15: Slowly lower the bands back down to your chest
column16: keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle.

column5: band one arm twisting chest press
column10: Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at chest height.
column11: Stand with your side facing the anchor point and grab the band with one hand.
column12: Step away from the anchor point to create tension in the band.
column13: Position your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bend your knees.
column14: Bring your hand holding the band across your body
column15: towards the opposite shoulder.
column16: While maintaining tension in the band
column17: push your hand forward and away from your body
column18: extending your arm.
column19: Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
column20: Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the other hand.

column10: Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
column11: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

column14: keeping your elbows tucked in.
column15: Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest.
column16: Push the barbell back up to the starting position by extending your arms.

column10: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your head lower than your hips.

column14: Pause for a moment at the bottom
column15: then push the barbell back up to the starting position.

column10: Lie down on a decline bench with your head lower than your hips and your feet secured.
column11: Hold the barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing away from you) and your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Extend your arms above your chest
column13: keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
column14: Lower the barbell in an arc motion behind your head
column15: feeling a stretch in your chest and shoulders.
column16: Pause for a moment

column10: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your head lower than your hips.

column12: slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column13: Lower the barbell to your chest
column14: keeping your elbows out to the sides.

column16: fully extending your arms.

column9: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a towel with both hands behind your head.

column9: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height.

column11: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.

column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight down by your sides.

column11: Sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.

column11: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.

column11: Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at ankle height.

column18: squeezing your glutes at the top.
column19: Lower your right leg back down and repeat with the left leg.
column20: Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the band around your ankles.
